stretching forward, solid defence
down on one knee and swept compactly to deep square leg
squared up on middle stump, reaching forward to smother the spin
walking into a defensive push to cover
solid full-faced block, back down the pitch
wide line, doesn't get up much, Lyon is hanging on the back foot, way outside leg, and can't reach that
neatly tucked into the leg side this time, as Lyon stands his ground on the back foot
loopy slower ball, right up to the blockhole, and pushed to the off side
right behind the line to block
sharp running between the wickets, to mid-on
that's a sweet strike, clean through the covers to bring up the fifty stand. South Africa's turn to look bereft of ideas
twirled up, outside off stump, a hint of turn as Paine leaves alone
dragged forward and tucked to the leg side
pushed to mid-on
flicked into the leg side
a pounding sweep, through the leg side. Not quite timed, but plenty intent
ouch, Maharaj wears this one in his followthrough as he drops into the long barrier to gather a firm push. An awkward bounce, right into the breadbasket
banged in Lyon, angled into the body, and hops over the top of a loose wafty uppercut
extra bounce from a full length, jagging over an attempted backfoot steer
short and misdirected, that's a poor ball but an excellent strike, attempting to cramp Lyon as he retreats to leg, but instead playing straight into his hands. Pulled firmly through the leg side
clears the front leg, and battered over the covers! Lyon is flying! Watched the ball right onto the bat, and belted it!
too much room this time, and misses with another wipe through the off side
a massive mow through the line! But Morkel jags this one back over the top of the stumps. A maiden fifty is on the cards for Lyon, and he knows how he wants to get there!
forward and pushed to cover
bissects keeper and slip with a late cut! Effective, if chancy. Not sure it was quite the intended shot...
pushed back down the pitch
left alone, and misses the off stump by a whisker! That was the arm ball, and it kept coming back in...
big stride to defend, head over the ball
pushed firmly, on the up, back to the bowler

slashed in the air ... Elgar back-pedals at point ... and takes the catch! Superbly judged, at full stretch, and what a brilliant cameo that was. Lyon deserved a maiden fifty, but kept attacking to the bitter end
well bowled, jagging back on the angle, and grazing past the off stump
stabbed into the covers, looking for two, but think better of it. Never run on a misfield, as they say...
nudged to mid-off to get off the mark
nibbling back into the right-hander
round the wicket, three slips in place, a sturdy clout to mid-off
outside off, curling away off the pitch, and through to the keeper
swinging in sharply, but down the leg side, flicks off the thigh pad but they decline the single
outside off, no stroke this time
dead-batted into the leg side, and this time they take the single. Two balls for Hazlewood to see off...
round the wicket, nips away, Hazlewood dangles the bat but is never in danger
dabbed to point off the back foot. Solid defence from the No.11. Australia keep their end up
swing on a full length, well watched onto the middle of the bat and clipped to mid-on
outside off, curling away, no stroke here
outside off, through to the keeper
a crunching drive, on the walk, but straight to short cover. A pleasing connection but nothing to show for it
inducker, climbs into the thigh pad as Paine shapes to leg
through to the keeper, as the umpires start to contemplate the light ...
round the wicket, slides down the leg side, short delivery and Hazelwood can gets out of the way without drama
dug in at the body, Hazlewood fends and gets a glove on it... and that will be four to fine leg, gets it away safely
back of a length, straightening a touch outside off as Hazlewood has a dabble and misses
pitched up, prodded into the covers coming across
good length, 143kph and tailing in towards the stumps, met with a solid block down the track
short, but casually flipped over gully for four! Knew what he was doing there, rocked back and angled the bat to ramp the ball fine of deep backward point, and tweak Rabada's tail in the process
shortish outside off, Paine swats a cut but finds deep point, they don't take the single
slightly short in the channel, left alone
back of a length, again wide enough for Paine to come across and leave
climbing through, 131kph as Morne starts off a touch ginger, no stroke
oh yeah, that's a beauty, fuller and curving away from the rough side, beats the outside edge as Paine feels for it
good length and zipping through to the keeper as he shoulders arms this time
short, 141kph and soaring through outside off as Hazlewood swings and misses
fires in the yorker, but Hazlewood is equal to it! This was full and straight at 143kph, but he gets the bat down and Gandalfs it  - 'You shall not pass!' - in front of the stumps
banged in short at the body, again Hazlewood plays the cheeky ramp, just one to third man this time
more short stuff and Paine hooks in the air, bounces out towards deep square leg

got him, steered to first slip! Hazlewood gives Rabada a fourth with a rather deferential fiddle, nicked to slip - and off they go, South Africa taking a handy 56-run lead on first innings (although it could have been a fair bit more)
fullish outside off, hint of inswing but he leaves it be
shouts of interest as Markram chops down late on the ball and Paine leaps to grab it... but was on the bounce
full length, Markram gets out and drives, plinked to point

dropped! Khawaja grasses a one-handed chance at gully! Starc throws his head back in anguish, it was a thick outside edge as Markram went hard at the ball, seemed to take Khawaja a bit by surprise, he might have been able to get there with both hands but the attempt looked casual and went straight to ground
slides on to the pads and flicked for four now! Just a tickle of bat, sends it fine, increasing Starc's frustrations
pitched up in the channel, he wisely lets this one go
good length in the channel outside off, nibbling back a touch and left alone
good footwork from Elgar, comes across and punches assertively towards mid-off
angled across and again he can leave alone in the channel
goes round the wicket now, 130kph on a length but wide of the stumps, no stroke
dug in short, a loopy bouncer sails down the leg side
back of a length, 137kph and rising over the stumps, Elgar grinds it up for flour to make his morning bread
length on off stump, Markram shuffles into line and taps the ball down
licks from Starc, 145kph and getting extravagant carry outside off, Paine has to leap for the take above his head as Markram shoulders arms
short of a length, closer to the stumps and Markram blocks steadily
banged in, 143kph on the body and tucked down to the leg side
shoooooootttttttttt! Not a bad ball from Starc but Markram is swiftly on to the front foot and booms a drive through the covers for a genuine boundary this time
dug in short, whistling through in the corridor as he drops the hands
angled in from round the wicket, defended on off
ooh, nicely bowled but Elgar gets away with a scissored prod, the ball shaped a touch as he brought the bat down at an angle, thick-edged low through gully for a few
in the channel, happy to leave
length ball, 136kph and sliding in, beautifully dealt with by Markram, just cushioned back down the ground, doesn't quite go all the way
back round the wicket, Elgar leaves alone outside off
length, 137kph and spitting towards the bat handle, Elgar jabs it away square on the leg side for one
Starc stays over the wicket to Elgar, puts it on a length, 143kph around off, defended
sprayed on to the pads, not enough swing to make this dangerous and Elgar stands and belts it through midwicket for four
hurled down straight and again it's meat and drink for Elgar, clipped for a couple more
corrects his line, touch short and wide, left alone
angled in and straightening on off, crabs across to blocks
bumper, very high and a touch leg side as Elgar crouches out of the way
length ball around off stump, Markram shows it he bat face
beauty from Hazlewood, holding its line and darting past the outside edge as Markram prods, can't get forward because of the length but somehow manages not to hit it
angled in with the arm once again, this time he lines up the block
back of a length, 131kph over the top of off, Markram defends
bit of width on offer, Markram steers the ball along the ground past gully for a couple
fired in straight, tucked to the leg side
slung down full in the channel outside off, 143kph and bunted to cover coming forwards
touch short, Markram comes across to defend
fullish, 146kph and gets him coming forwards, blocked firmly towards extra cover
slightly straighter line, tapped down from the crease
slanted across on a length, 145kph and left alone as he stays back
pitched up outside off, Markram squeezes down on it to send the ball square
round the wicket to the lefty, who sidles across and leaves
pitched up, tempting him forwards to drive and Elgar does just that, clouted firmly through cover point and it races away
dug in, 140kph and veering back late as Elgar withdraws his bat, elicits a grunt of exclamation as the ball flies past
pitched up and blocked coming forwards
full in the channel again, Elgar taps this one away
continues to explore a good length outside off, comes across and leaves
good length, Markram plays around his front pad and turns it to Bancroft under the helmet, he snaps the ball up and lobs it back on to the stumps - but he hadn't left his crease
sliding across in the corridor, Markram sticks his head out and gets the all clear, leaves
back of a length, 140kph and it skips through a bit low, wide enough to ignore again
closer to off stump, full and squished into the covers, no run there
fullish again, pushed without timing into the covers
Starc beats out a tattoo on the middle of the pitch, 140kph/87mph and climbing through above the ducking batsman

pitched up, gets him driving... and gets him taken at slip! Uncharacteristically loose from Elgar and SA's first-innings linchpin departs; there were signs that he wanted to drive at Cummins in his first over, he picked up a boundary but this time it costs him. Sixth catch in the match for Smith
on the pads, tucked behind square
angled into the hips once more, Amla nudges down into the leg side
better line and length, with good lift off the deck just outside off. Amla leaves alone
nipping back into the batsman from outside off, Amla props forward to defend and accepts the single to midwicket to get off the mark
well bowled! Very full, pinging off the seam like a legbreak and missing a loose drive by a whisker
shoulders arms outside off
ploughing away on a fourth-stump line. Not a whole lot of carry on this occasion as Amla leaves alone
dangling it out there, looks like the beginnings of a plan to the new batsman, as Hazlewood tempts the drive but Amla wants nothing to do with it
outside off, not a lot of carry once more. No stroke
fuller and straighter, angling back into the right-hander, and stabbed out to cover
a thumping drive on a full length, but squirts out to point
pushed onto the back foot by a tight line. Defended into the covers
solidly behind the line of the ball
ooh, a bit of an edge on this occasion as Cummins attacks the splice on a tight line. The ball bobbles towards the cordon but doesn't carry
bouncer. Amla ducks. Good take from Paine behind the timbers
tucked to the leg side
top strike, as Cummins over-pitches a fraction and Amla pummels a straight drive back at his shins. Intercepted on this occasion, but good intent
banged in short, and ducked
on the back foot, and punched into the off side
clipped firmly through midwicket, the sweeper hustles round to intercept
pushed onto the back foot, and poked into the off side
outside off, a hint of lateral movement but no stroke offered
pushed onto the back foot, and blocked into the off side
flicked off the hip, down to backward square leg
squeezed defence off the back foot, as Cummins lines up the top of off stump with another sharp delivery
fuller length, tucked into the leg side
short and wide, sharp lift through to the keeper as Markram leaves alone
fuller length, attacking the stumps, and nudged into the covers
firmly driven, head over the ball, but short cover intercepts
outside off, Hazlewood's line has been consistently six inches too wide to tempt a stroke this morning
up on the toes, dabbed down into the gully
drilled straight to mid-off
short and leg-sided, Markram squats in his stance to let the ball sing by
thumped through the covers! That's a fine strike, capitalising on that consistent width and rifled out to the boundary
left alone once more
excellent strike! Amla takes the aggressive option as Cummins bangs one in short, rolling his wrists on impact to nail it through square leg
fuller length, outside off, a controlled edge down into the gully
llfting delivery on a full length, jagging off the seam as Amla leaves alone
tight line from Cummins, a hint of away movement, once again a calm leave from the batsman
solidly behind the line, dead-batted into the covers
well bowled again, and well left. Just outside off, with excellent carry. It's a mug's game trying to put bat on those
blocked on the back foot
outside off, left alone
fully forward, blocked back down the pitch
nudged into the leg side
width, and this is lashed through the covers, off the back foot. That's an excellent confident strike, but a rare drag-down from Lyon
tossed up on a full length, and blocked
full length, blocked back down the pitch, body right behind the line
back of a length, tapped to midwicket for another quick single
outside off, no stroke offered as Cummins once again finds good lift off the deck.
banged in short, Amla limboes out of harm's way
sharp bouncer, if a touch too high to truly trouble Amla, who flinches out of harm's way
outside off, stabbed off the back foot to point
tossed up on a good length outside off, a bottom-handed waft out to midwicket
swished across the line, out to square leg
very full once more, lots of air, right up to the toes of the batsman, who blocks
stretching forward to smother the spin
on the pads, nudged to the leg side once more
tweaked down the leg side, well gathered by Paine
up on the toes, pushed off the back foot to the off side
sharp lift outside off once more, as Markram this time has a go with a back-foot punch. Gathered at point, but that was a touch chancy

and again! This time it flies for four, but Markram knew nothing about that, the leaping bounce meant he was never in control once he'd committed to the stroke, and was very lucky not to splice it to gully
pushed onto the back foot, fuller and straighter this time
bouncer. Markram ducks
squeezed into the off side from a fuller length
turning from middle to leg, Amla leans into the angle and flicks a perfectly timed leg glance straight to the rope. Wrists and technique. Lovely
pushed onto the back foot, a late stabbed defensive push
on the legs once more, and nudged round the corner
tossed up, and defended to the leg side
slides onto the back foot to create room for a punch-slap to mid-on, and a quick single
punching off the back foot again but no way through this time
wafted into the leg side
right behind the line to defend
dropped short, Markram has a hefty swing across the line, and where's this gone? Marsh can't pick it up at cow corner, and it's lucky but safe!
solid in defence once more
almost exaggerated commitment to the defensive block
solidly dug out, and that will be lunch
flighted, 88kph and drifting in then out on off stump, blocked coming forwards by Amla
looped up, Amla gets an even bigger stride in and smothers the ball
flatter, turning in from outside off, defended playing back
touch slower, bouncing up as Amla goes into the crease, jabs a single past the diving Bancroft at short leg
goes round the wicket to Markram, who stays still on off stump and defends
pushed through a touch flatter, tapped away
fullish, slung down in the channel, wide enough to leave alone comfortbaly
drops short, 143kph and rapped past gully, Amla on his toes to ride the bounce and slash a cut for four
steep bounce from back of a length, shading back in and rising past the armpit as Amla throws his hands up
fuller, around off stump, Amla blocks
dug in as Amla walks across, once again he gets his bat well up out of the way as the ball zips through

bumper, angled in and Amla takes this on, goes for the pull... and it's given, caught behind! But Amla immediately reviews, and it looks like it came off the shoulder. Yep, he knew there was no bat/glove on it as he went to pull
looped up full from round the wicket, Markram defends calmly
pushed through and clipped off the pads for one
over the wicket, flighted and blocked coming forwards on off
sliding down the leg side, into the gloves as Amla flicks and misses
superbly swept, taken from outside off stump and directed fine with those magnificent wrists, lots of power on it and that'll be four
pushed through flat outside off, Amla shoulders arms
fired down in the channel, Markram diverts it into a gap
back of a length in the channel, no stroke
short and squirted down the leg side, Amla happy to leave well alone

short, leg side again, 142kph and Amla can't lay bat on it, then Paine manages only fingertips, the ball flying away over his head for byes - that's the fifty stand between these two, every run squeezing Australia further
back of length outside off and once again Amla lets it go
dug in short, 140kph and swerving leg side, this time Paine manages to get across as Amla ducks
Markram comes across and works one through midwicket
flattish offbreak, Amla lets it go
tossed up on off, defended
floated up full, Amla zens another front-foot block
round the wicket to Amla now, trying to disturb his bubble, blocked playing back
touch short, on the stumps and worked away behind square on the leg side
Starc continues to pound the pitch, Amla gets his gear out of the way
goes full now, 142kph outside off, Amla looks in the mood today, pops on his magician's hat and waves his wand, spiriting the ball away thorugh the covers, Warner doing good work to prevent four
comes across and plays a fullish ball back down the pitch
shorter, wide enough to cut but sent to point
back of a length, Markram stabs a drive down square on the off side
full outside off, 143kph and driven crisply but straight to mid-off
round the wicket to Hash, who taps the on side
floated up, slightly too full and this is clipped off the front pad for a single
pushed through, Markram strokes a drive gently towards cover
pushed through quicker, defended on off
take that! Imperious from Markram, just a couple of steps out of his ground, then launched with a clean swing straight back over the bowler's head for six
flatter and a touch leg side, tickled off the pads
back of a length, 144kph around off stump, defended
comes across to block a shortish ball once again
oof, he wears this one, a really body blow as Markram tries to duck but the ball keeps coming at him, struck on the ribs - but he's able to shake it off
tucked to the on side, Markram calls the single and he has to get a move on, Cummins' throw is a direct hit from mid-on... but he was just home
round the wicket still, pitched up and pushed into the covers
good length, rising up at 142kph, dabbed cautiously into the off side
fullish, wobbly in the channel and spanked through the covers
Amla comes across and whips through the leg side for another single
full and straight and tickled through the leg side
shorter, Amla gets an inside edge on to his body, the ball drops down and Markram quickly calls him through for a safe run
gets into line on off stump

fullish, worked across the line, Markram wants another quick single and this could be a stretch... but it was a difficult pick up and throw for Cummins, Markram scrambles home and then raises his bat for fifty, second time he has got there in the series
Starc spears the ball down in the channel outside off, left alone
length ball, Markram shows it a solid straight bat on off stump
dabbed down into the leg side, they pinch another single, bringing up the SA 100 in the process
shortish outside off stump, Amla lets it go
short and rising wide of the stumps once again, nothing doing
pitched up, 143kph and met with a resolute straight bat, blocked to mid-off
angled in with the arm, Markram shows it the maker's name
good length, touch wider and he lets this one go
pitched up, 131kph outside off stump, met with a firm push into the covers
line and length outside off, the ball too old to swing but not yet ready to let its hair down and do some reverse dad dancing... no stroke offered
good length, tailing in a fraction at 135kph, Markram leaves once again
whump, smashed through cover for four! Overpitched by Hazlewood and Markram loves to go for a drive, sends the ball screaming to the rope
in the corridor, 142kph, good carry but left well alone
probing away outside off, Amla plays the watching brief
fuller and closer to the stumps, tapped to mid-off
veering in from back of a length, Amla continues to abstain

oh, he's given it away, chipped straight to cover! Amla goes when set again, perhaps signs that the old master is on the wane... It was pitched up, inviting the drive, but the Mighty Hash used to leave those all day, until they were just right. Instead, he's made a mighty hash of that, and given Australia an opening
slightly short and wide, curling away as de Villiers comes across and leaves
fired in at the body, deflected down via the inside edge past his pads, but lands safely
length, rising around the line of off, defended stoutly
comes across, 136kph and blocked into the covers
yip, that's a nasty ball, swerving in late as Markram defends, ricochets into the thigh... too high for lbw, maybe some bat involved, too
lines this one up and dead-bats in defence
good length, pushed in with the arm and tucked to the leg side
touch short, holding its line outside off, no stroke
comes across and lets another go

drops short, de Villiers is never a man to let a bowler settle, smashed in front of cover... flies all the way for six, in fact! A ferocious tennis forehand, Cummins dispatched with impunity. And there's some verbals from the bowler, in reply
shortish outside off, drops back and lets this go
fuller length, AB comes forward and pings the ball to mid-off
good length, maybe reversing a touch outside off, left alone once more
outside off, tight line, left alone
angling into the pads, cuffed behind square. Easy pickings
fully forward and blocked back down the pitch

edged and brilliantly caught dropped! Oh wow, what an effort that was, a hard-handed drive from Markram, Smith at second slip flung himself to his right, parallel to thr ground, clung on in one hand, but couldn't control it as he hit the turf! Amazing effort!
outside off, more calmly negotiated
squared up on off stump and defended
outside off, no stroke offered as the ball fizzes by
no stroke offered as Cummins dangles it outside off
solidly behind the line
thumped on the up with lots of bottom hand, Cummins sticks a boot out to intercept. Neat work
guided into the covers with a full face of the bat
whistles through at good pace as de Villiers draws his bat inside the line
well bowled, nip off the seam from back of a length, Markram comes across to play and is forced into a late adjustment
firmly behind the line, head over the ball to defend on off stump
banged in short, and a short-arm pull down to backward square. Well controlled, and Cummins on the boundary's edge does well to intercept
outside off, through to the keeper, bending back from wide on the crease
standing tall on the back foot, letting nothing past
tailing into off stump, bending through the air as it goes. A firm push through the line to mid-on
outside off, and through to the keeper
poked into the off side
hint of reverse swing as the ball bends from middle towards off, met with a stabbed defensive push to the leg side
zinged through to the keeper
defended on the back foot, and pushed back down the pitch
climbing through to the keeper on a very tight line, no stroke
wide of off stump, jagging away, Markram soaks up another dot ball
another leave, but a better line, angling into the off stump and demanding a swift bit of trigonometry before the bat is raised for no stroke
left alone once more
fractionally overpitched, and Markram latches onto the loose one! A big stride, full face, pumped through the covers. Excellent Test-match batting
stands tall on the back foot to drive back to the bowler
angling into the off stump, Markram squares up to cover the line and poke back down the pitch
worked round the corner to backward square leg
left alone outside off, this one dribbles through to the keeper on the second bounce
a crunching drive, but not quite the power to match the pleasing bat sound. Gathered at mid-off
short, leg-sided, de Villiers ducks
angled defence down through third man, and de Villiers picks off another valuable four
clipped hard off the pads, out to backward square leg
well played and placed again, leaning into the outswinger to punch a controlled drive to cover
outside off, holds its line as Markram leaves alone
another gently curling outswinger, on a good line and length, and dabbed down into the gully
through to the keeper again, AB leaves alone with a flourish, guarding the line with his front pad
fuller length, swinging away, crunched to mid-off
pushed into the off side
drawn forward to meet the full length with a compact drive
punched into the off side
back of a length, attacking the ribs and tucked to the leg side
outside off, angling in towards the off stump, but grazes past the edge. Tight leave!
over-pitched and clobbered out through the covers! That's sublime, a big stride and a full face, piercing the in-field
nip and bounce from a good length, Markram is startled by the lift and removes his bottom hand as the ball jams his fingers. Well bowled
steady outswing on a tight line. Defended
a bit more room to free the arms with a bottom-handed tonk through the off side
outside off stump, left alone once more
defended back down the pitch, pushed onto the back foot
no stroke offered
pulled majestically over square leg! Picked the length early, threw the kitchen sink at it, and pumped it high into the stands!
defended off the back foot
outside off, through to the keeper with a flourish
whipped on the up through the leg side
outside off, no stroke this time as de Villiers turns his back on the ball to remove his gloves from harm's way
eased back down the pitch to mid-on
stands tall on the back foot to punch out to point
clipped firmly out to the leg side
no stroke offered this time
keeper is up to the stumps, and gathers once more as Marsh fires this one outside off stump
a touch of width, and that was clobbered hard off the back foot into the covers, but Shaun Marsh does well to defend his brother's figures
leaning forward, head over the ball
driven once more, climbing into the full length, and cut off by the cover sweeper. It's all a bit flat for Australia at the moment, as the lead slips past 200
round the wicket, angling into the pads, tucked behind square
jabbed down through third man, riding the bounce and steering it down through the cordon. Up comes the 150, and South Africa are cruising at this precise moment in time
outside off, climbing off the deck and left alone

chipped to mid-on! Deary me, that's as soft as the cheese in Bancroft's pocket ... on the pads, clipped airily, and straight to the fielder. And once again, the interval brings a very timely breakthrough
outside off, through to the keeper
fully forward and blocked back down the pitch
hits a good length outside off, holding its line and left alone
touch short, AB latches on a cracks a cut away through backward point, the scoreboard ticking again
jabbed down towards his toes as he hops across
pitched up, 138kph and driven without timing towards mid-on
this reverses in a good way from outside off but de Villiers plays it late, guided wide of slip for a couple
back of a length, nipping in but this time he doesn't need to play
pitched up from round the wicket, du Plessis gets well forward and clips a couple on the drive
length, 144kph and swerving away in the channel as Faf stays back and shoulders arms
length ball, gets across and shoulders arms
pitched up, gets well forward and stays low to drive, sends it to the in-fielder
this keeps going with the arm, good length but FdP judges it well and leaves be
full, 143kph and flicked away through square leg, no one there and they get back for three
length, shaping away outside off as du Plessis comes across
comes across and lets this one go
oof, this sharks back in at du Plessis, fiendish late movement and he takes it on the body
pitched up, 141kph and this time du Plessis lines it up in defence
length, 138kph and left alone outside off
dug in short, trampoline bounce outside off, Faf throws his head back and leaves
full, worked off the legs to the fielder square
woah, that's brutalised through midwicket! Pitched up on middle stump, swung hard to leg, flew like a rocket to the rope
shorter and outside off, lets this one go
hello, cheeky... This is a bit too close to cut, so at the last minute, de Villiers basically decides to deliberately top edge the ball, sends it flying over the slips for four!
length, angled in at 142kph and tapped away
hammered into the pitch, ABdV jumps into line and defends towards his toes
yeesh, this is tough batting, Hazlewood sears past the outside edge, reversing the ball at pace
in the channel, Faf comes across and lets it go
hurled down on a length, beginning to straighten a touch as it thuds into the splice, well defended
back of a length, 139kph and Faf drops it down softly
oh, Faf's been knocked off his feet! Full and straight, looking for the blockhole, does well to keep it out by chopping the ball into his boot
picks up four now, gliding a short delivery down to third man off the back foot... Fast bowlers always love that
short outside off, de Villiers gets into line
slightly back of a length and again defended solidly
slams it down hard at 137kph, good length over off stump, tapped back down the wicket
ooh, draws a slight error from AB, arrowing on the stumps and then holding its line a smidge, a thick edge flies past point as he looked to drive through mid-on
tight lines, Faf covers his stumps, battling away in the trenches out there
length, straightening again, du Plessis blocks and continues to talk himself through the innings
round the wicket, lobbed up on off stump, blocked
floated up full, AB defends in front of the stumps
flatter delivery, chopped down towards his toes
goes back and flicks past short leg, AB wants two... but he won't get it
tossed up, a touch wider and steered towards point
full and flighted, worked to the leg side
short of a length, 139kph and rising towards the body, nudged away behind square leg
fullish outside off, prodded square from the crease
pitched up, du Plessis reaches for the drive and sends it streaking past point, not entirely in control but he gets four
134kph on a length outside off, shoulders arms
shortens his length, whistling through a foot outside off as Faf hangs back
crumbs, where has that hit him?! This ball has spat at du Plessis like an angry llama... Took him right on the bottom hand, he immediately wheeled away
floated up on the stumps and nudged into a gap leg side
covers the stumps, defended
tossed up full straight and flicked through square leg
flighted, AB leans on a front-foot block
given some air, de Villiers gets front on defending under his nose
pushed through a bit quicker and de Villiers skims one more off his pads
shortish and dropped down into the leg side for a quick single
latches on to the pull, thumped to the fence! That's a pretty good response to being hit on the hand, take the next short ball you're bowled and clothesline it through midwicket!
back of a length in the channel, left alone this time
at the body, turned for a single in front of square leg
whoosh, this takes off as de Villiers stays back - try pulling that one
more short stuff, keeps AB in his box for the over
floated up full and tapped to the leg side
flighted, around off stunmp, Faf drops back to defend
pushed through, worked around the corner off the legs
over the wicket to AB, who taps down to the leg side
oh, lovely stuff, turns the hands over and reaches forward before swatting a crisp reverse sweep for four, much to Lyon's chagrin

pushed through flatter and AB flicks across the line, misses the ball... and it actually deflects up off the thigh pad to hit Tim Paine in the chin. But he's wearing a helmet and protected from damage
drops short, width on offer and du Plessis hammers a drive in front of square, Bancroft gets down quickly to stop it in the covers
fired in straighter, played with a straight bat
full outside off, 141kph and steered towards point
short ball, doesn't get up that much but the line is wide and du Plessis bails out of his pull
good lines, du Plessis comes across and blocks it towards point
drops short in the channel outside off, left alone
looped up from round the wicket, de Villiers tickles a drive through mid-on

over the wicket, gives this some rip and the ball turns in to trap du Plessis on the crease... Richard Illingworth shakes his head, but David Warner, deputising for Smith, reviews. Height the main question? Maybe spinning too much from the straight, too; certainly no bat involved... but Hawk-Eye says it's smashing leg stump! An excellent review from Australia, and Faf's mini-revival in form is chopped down
tossed up around off stump, worked to mid-on
'catch!' bellows Lyon as Bavuma takes on the sweep, it's in the air for a long while but clear of backward square leg and bounces away to give him a boundary for his first runs
tossed up on the stumps and tapped into a gap
tossed up full, AB plants the front foot to defend

draws him forwards, takes the edge - and it's scooped up at second slip! Peter Handscomb is the catcher, on the field for Smith, and he's grabbed that brilliantly. Testing line from Hazlewood but Bavuma has twice in this Test looked like a man severely out of middle practice
round the wicket, 140kph in the channel outside off, slashed for a couple
oof, close to the stumps, de Kock isn't far from chopping this on as he brings the bat down at an angle
comes across and taps into the covers
banged in short, 138kph and jabbed away, thought about pulling but didn't really follow through, the ball rolls to midwicket
length delivery, met on the front foot and steered to mid-off
pushed through with plenty of revs on the ball, AB defends from the crease
flighted, plays around the front pad and taps back to the bowler
tossed up straight and worked to the leg side
pushed through and turned towards midwicket
floated up on off stump, prodded away
flat on the stumps, steered square from the crease
Full length, outside off from round the wicket, a squeezed drive out to deep cover
up on the toes, wafting a defensive push out to point
a crunching drive into the covers. Firm contact but straight to the fielder
opens the face to glide a back-drive down through backward point
clipped to the leg side
full length on off stump, another firm full-faced drive to mid-off
worked into the covers with a bottom-handed push
round the wicket, nudged to leg from a middle and leg line
striding forward, meeting the angle from round the wicket
fuller length, across the right-hander, punched with a high elbow to short leg
nudged off the pads, short leg in business again
onto the front foot, and blocked away
round the wicket, defended on the back foot, down into the crease
on the legs, clipped to the leg side
banged in short, hauled around the corner down to backward square leg
clipped firmly out to deep midwicket
fully forward, head over the ball, defending into the off side
a massive mow outside off stump, and no connection, fortunately either for batsman or bowler, depending on the nature of that connection!
stretching forward to block
pushed back down the pitch once more
a big appeal but seemed to strike him outside the line, yep easily so. A big stride
turn and bounce, raps the edge and flies past slip! Lucky, a moral victory for the bowler
clipped out to deep midwicket, a more confident stroke.
and now, as if by magic, QDK has 12 runs in three balls and he's flying! Marching to the pitch of the ball, a lusty swing up through the line, and over the ropes at long-on!
tight line, good pace, defended
outside off, dabbed into the covers
tight line again, lifting into the body and de Villiers nurdles another single to the leg side
a punched drive to mid-off
banged in short, down the leg side
punched into the covers, to keep the strike with a quick single
panned over the leg side! Down on one knee and really looking to lift the tempo now
paddled around the corner to rotate the strike
squared up on middle and leg, pushed back down the pitch
reverse sweep! De Villiers fillets another four through what was third man, and up comes his half-century! His second of the Test and another emphatic stamp of class
tucked to the leg side
defended back down the line of the ball
chopped down to deep backward point
round the wicket, confidently onto the front foot, searching for the drive. Can't beat mid-off but the intent is plain
full length, and punched into the covers
jags back off the seam and defended
bouncer, avoided
outside off, firmly pumped into the covers
slip and short leg in place, round the wicket, dabbed to the leg side
nudged into the covers
firmly behind the line, worked out to midwicket
deflected out to deep square leg
tossed up, outside the off stump, drilled hard into the covers
big stride onto the front foot, and blocked out to gully
outside off, no stroke offered
banged in short, and through to the keeper
full face of the bat, presented to the ball. Pushed back down the line
ooh, this one pops, a cross-seamer, lifting into de Villiers' gloves as he shapes to cut. Awkward
a big stride, no stroke
defended with a hop as Cummins finds some extra steam on a good length
Marsh starts with a full delivery outside off. De Kock drives to cover to the man of the moment, Bancroft
short and wide outside off, too wide. Carved away through gully. Played that discernibly late to find the gap in front of the fielder
goes back to a fuller length, full outside off, de Kock presses forward to defend.
wider again outside off, 123 kph. Too wide to draw a stroke in the first over of the day. Left alone
just about medium pace. De Kock gets forward and defends
too full from Marsh, and de Kock just needs to get forward and caress a drive through cover. The timing is good, the placement is good, four
floated up full from round the wicket, de Villiers tickles one though mid-on
pushed through quicker on leg stump, de Kock goes back and clips behind square for a quick one
presses forward to defend around the line of off
'beautiful Lyono' chirps the new Australia captain behind the stumps, as AB comes forward to block
fractionally short from Lyon, not so beautiful and de Villiers chips in on the aesthetic stakes himself with a sumptuous back-foot punch through the coves for four
gets into line and taps the ball away
full in the channel outside off, left alone
de Kock comes across and pushes back down the track
shorter, 138kph and coming in from outside off, de Kock rolls the wrists and flicks through midwicket
pushed on to the pads, de Villiers glances to fine leg, some polite applause around the ground
dug in short, climbing through outside off stump
overpitched, wide of the stumps and de Kock leans into a bristling cover drive that whistles to the rope. Spanked
tossed up on the stumps and tapped to leg
pushed through and worked towards mid-on
shuffles into line and turns down to midwicket
de Villiers skips out and clips one down the ground
flat, not much turn and defended on off
dragged down, that's a gimme but de Kock cracks his cut shot straight to backward point
Cummins goes over the wicket, hits a length in the channel, no stroke
shortish, 142kph and pushed away defensively
dug in at the body, AB calmly waits on the back foot and nudges one through square leg
round the wicket, full length, 139kph and blocked coming forwards
plugging away outside off, left alone
shorter, 139kph and veering in at de Kock, who tries to cut and ends up dabbing it down towards the cordon, Paine grabs it on the dive one-handed
comes down and taps a single down the ground
half a shout for lbw as de Kock lunges forward, think there was a chunk of inside edge on that
flighted, angled in from round the wicket, pushed away
tapped down square on the off side
flatter delivery, de Kock takes a couple of steps down and smothers it
tossed up around middle and off, blocked from the crease
short delivery, worked off the hip behind square
round the wicket, Cummins hits a length in the corridor, no stroke
de Kock comes across and shoulders arms
probing, touch too wide again
slightly short, wide of the stumps and de Kock shoulders arms again
touch fuller, 133kph a foot outside off, Quinny practises his leave
floated up full, tapped down and Paine walks around to field
slightly shorter and leg side, nudged down
flighted, straightening on off stump, de Villiers defends
drops short and de Villiers stays back, whips the ball away through midwicket
pushed through, defended to the leg side
tossed up, QdK comes forward and blocks
length in the channel, no stroke

chipped... but short of mid-off this time! That's how he got out to Cummins in the first innings, remember, having made almost exactly the same score. Went for the drive but was through it early, survives this time
jumps into line and lets the ball go
short of a length outside off, dabbed square and there's loud call of 'No!'
back of a length, de Villiers opens the face and plays this behind square for a single
pitched up, de Kock is well into line and larrups the ball through backward point for a boundary, closing in on his fifty
over the wicket, fired down in the channel outside off, no stroke
good length, driven into the ground towards point
139kph outside off, comes across and lets this one go
back of a length, whizzing through as de Villiers stays back
length, 143kph and a touch wide, into the gloves again
that's a good line, whirring in over the top of off stump, de Villiers jumps across and blocks to the on side
pitched up in the channel, de Kock drives and it comes off the inside half of the bat
fullish, around the line of off, shows it a correct forward block
drifting on to the pads, flicked behind square
ooh, beats the bat, short and wide and he throws the hands, doesn't connect
fuller, 134kph on middle and off, pushed towards mid-on

draws him across, prances to take the edge - gone! That's good bowling, Hazlewood briefly turning our attention back to the game with a rising delivery, utilising the hard, new nut - it flew off the edge and Marsh pouched it safely to prise de Villiers from the crease in the 60s for the second time in the match
full on the pads, belted through midwicket, a dismissive clip for four and that's his fifty up, raise of the bat to applause around Newlands for Quinny
length ball, touch too straight again and dinked in the air through midwicket
touch short, 143kph over middle and leg, Philander tucks it fine
dug in, this climbs like a Tibetan mountain ranger, beats the top edge as de Kock aims a cut
length ball, tucked into the leg side
short of a length, rearing through to the keeper as Philander throws his hands up
Hazlewood round the wicket, good length around off stump, blocked into the covers
ooh, where's that gone... back of a length and then jagging away off a crack, or some such, de Kock doesn't follow it
back of a length outside off, left alone
fuller, 133kph and wide of the stumps, de Kock leans into a drive and times this like a Rolex for four
angled in short of a length at the batsman, who dabs back down the track
ooh, lovely bowling, sliding in and then holding its line, completely suckers de Kock... but misses the edge
Philander watches the ball closely and nudges for one, gets off strike
pitched up, taken off the pads through square leg

banged in, Philander loses control on the hook... but Hazlewood steps on the rope as he tries to takes the catch! That was clearing fine leg, would have needed some acrobatics to bring it back in for a catch... and, to be honest, Hazlewood didn't really look in the mood
pitched up and punched through cover now, nicely played by Philander, wielding his cudgel to good effect
on the pads, this is clipped fine, that'll be four more! Frustrations mount for Starc - and the SA lead goes above 350
now Starc oversteps, fractionally, called by Nigel Llong
slams in the bumper to finish, Paine leaps to collect
good length, 133kph and blocked pressing forwards
fired in on off stump, clips the inside edge and rolls to safety as he gets out to defend
tight lines, another front-foot block
straying on to the pads from round the wicket, turned through square leg
gets a bit too straight again and Philander works it through the leg side
pitched up and quietly defended by de Kock - he seems intent on building further, shutting Australia out of the game
outside off, shaping away, through to the keeper
round the wicket, through to the keeper once more, angling into the stumps
through to the keeper once again with more good carry. This pitch has held up well in terms of bounce (even if Australia found it to be lacking in lateral movement...)
very full length, clipped out through midwicket with a flourish
speared down the leg side
a touch of width, cracked through point
nurdled off the hip to the leg side
outside off, and through to the keeper
dabbed down through third man
round the wicket, right up to the toes, stoutly defended on the front foot
forward and blocked into the off side
cuts back in off the pitch, defended in front of off stump
round the wicket, and thumped off the up through the covers! Handsome stroke, right under the eyeline, bottom-handed wallop with an open face. Have some of that!
tremendous follow-up! A sweetly timed clip through midwicket as Starc strains for non-existent swing. South Africa are rattling along now
this is a triumphantly dismissive over for Philander, short and wide, flings the bat over third man, and Starc is being picked apart
round the wicket once more, much fuller length, and clipped to mid-on
sliding into the pads, fenced through backward square
flicks the pad
very tight to off stump, left alone on length. Good judgment, I think...
leaning forward to defend to cover
full and straight, Philander's bat turns in his hand on impact and nearly pops the ball back to the bowler
wider line, full length, no stroke offered
crunched off the back foot into the covers, a good half stop, at full stretch
short and wide, flashed dismissively down through third man! He's having one of his days with the willow
chiselled on the up, back past the bowler
fully forward, and blocked back down the pitch
defended into the leg side, on the front foot again
decent spin from outside off, but wafted behind square
swept hard behind square
advancing down the track, aggressive intent, but blocked in the end
on the back foot, and defended back down the pitch
pushed into the off side
outside off, and no stroke offered
worked out to the leg side, and up comes the fifty stand. Philander has bossed it too
round the wicket, banged in short, way over the batsman's head
fully forward and punched down the ground
pushed back down the pitch
twirled onto a good length, tucked to the leg side
driven, but not quite to the pitch, the ball loops up on the leg side for a moment, but safely so
flicked off the pads, but can't beat the fielder
worked round the corner, picked up behind square
punched out to the covers
defended to the off side

round the wicket, advancing down the pitch, tries to drive, and edges through to the keeper! De Kock cramped himself for room in the end there, but he's played a fine hand, and put South Africa in a very dominant position
round the wicket, pitched up to the toes, clipped firmly into the leg side
forward and blocked back down the pitch
blocked on the back foot, into the off side
short once again, and that's far too short for the batsman to reach
a big wafting drive into empty space, no contact as Paine gathers
outside off, and through to the keeper once again
worked into the covers
sharp turn as Philander tries to play this one off the back foot. Takes the glove but flies safe
round the wicket now, pushed to the off side
forward and worked to the leg side, head over the ball
defended down through the gully
tucked out to midwicket, watchful defence on the front foot
watchful in defence
nipping away outside off as Philander removes his bottom hand to control a defensive push
too short, too wide, flogged with a booming flourish out to the cover sweeper
pushing hard outside off stump, beaten by the pace and carry
more lively carry outside off, Rabada has a go, as he well might, but can't make contact
pushed on the up out through the covers
flogged firmly out through backward point
stretching forward on the front foot to block back down the pitch
head over the ball, no way through there
straightens on a good length, leaping towards the gloves
pushed to the off side, good bounce for Lyon, which will please Maharaj, in particular
a swing and a miss! Turn and bounce outside off stump
fully forward and pushed back down the pitch
edged and drops short of first slip! Surprising that Cummins of all people didn't get carry from a genuine nick. Just died on impact, soft hands maybe
this one carries all right! A perfect seamer, ripping past the splice and just failing to get the nick. Well bowled
stoutly forward, meeting the full length with a full face
forward once again
flicking on the up into the leg side
fully forward and blocked into the off side
standing tall on the back foot, and defended again
a quicker flatter delivery, attacking the stumps but Rabada is equal to it
out comes the drive this time, compactly drilled to wide mid-off
leaning onto the front foot and pushed down the pitch
nudged into the leg side, and thus ends another fine session for South Africa.
starts short and wide of the stumps, 133kph and Rabada has a swing and misses
back of a length and defended from the crease
better line, 144kph and nipping away in the channel, Rabada plays inside it
pitched up, draws a wild flash from the No. 9, into the keeper's gloves again
shortish at the body, 142kph and Rabada blocks towards mid-on
back of a length outside off, wide enoguh to leave
over the wicket to the right-hander, floated up on off stump, defended
stays in the crease and taps it down
sharp spin this time, past the inside edge of the bat as Philander leans out and prods at the ball
length ball, spinning in and this time tucked to the leg side
pushed through a touch short outside off, Philander hammers it through point for a few more
floated up on the stumps and nudged away to the on side
short of a length in the channel and Rabada can leave
again Starc is not close enough to the stumps to make him play
short of a length, 139kph and rising around fourth stump, defended towards cover
in the corridor, no stroke
dug in, Rabada goes for the pull... and sends it off the cue end towards mid-off, falls short
back of a length, fading away outside off stump and Rabada keeps his powder dry
tucked down the ground for one
round the wicket, lobbed up on off and defended
pushed through flatter, tucked to leg
flighted, gets Rabada reaching forwards but he manages to steer it along the ground behind point
tossed up and defended on the front foot
given some air, Rabada plays it confidently back through mid-off and trots the single
cracked through backward point, insouciant shot from Rabada! Bit of width and he sends it rattling away
pitched up on the pads, 146kph, clipped square with a flourish this time... SA's lead ticks up to 400, to much applause around the ground
full and worked away behind square leg for another single
shot! That went with a rifle report of the bat, dug in and pulled flat and hard to deep midwicket, stoking up the Protea fans even more
four more, flicked down the leg side! Short and on the pads, Rabada just needed to get some bat on it
lets this go in the channel
floated up on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
Big Vern shuffles across and flicks the ball behind square for one
round the wicket, defended

Rabada charges down, beaten in the flight - that's a simple stumping for Paine! Lyon snares his 300th Test wicket, following Morne Morkel to the mark in the same match. Big ole yahoo from Rabada and although he made an attempt to get back, it was in vain
pushed through quickly and worked across the line to square leg
tossed up and blocked firmly towards point
touch full and tailing in on the stumps, clipped off his front pad
back of a length, 137kph in the channel and Maharaj tries to hoon it through point, misses
excellent length, around the line of off, tapped watchfully to extra cover
slashed away for four, bit of width and he slices it behind point for a boundary
back of a length, disciplined line and he leaves
touch short, over the top of off stump, shows it the bat face in defence
floated up and tapped back towards the bowler
more stoic defence on off stump
tossed up, this spins in as he comes across
gives this some air and it rags in, hits the inside edge and squirts low to short leg
now extra bounce - this pitch is coming alive before our eyes! - and Philander has to fend it away
flighted, comes forward and pushes in front of square
good length ball around off, tapped down in compact fashion
shorter, this time he has a woolly woof at it and fails to connect
full length, 138kph and met coming forwards, driven to mid-off
bangs the ball in short, heading down the leg side as Maharaj nods it through
fuller outside off, dabbed neatly through backward point for one
on the stumps, good length and filched through backward square leg for one more
comes across on off and pushes into the covers
tossed up, spinning in and defended
tries to come down but that was telegraphed and Lyon fires it in, Philander has to make sure it doesn't get past him
ooh, was that off the glove? Extra bounce, Lyon's overspin coming into play, Philander flicked it off the hip and Bancroft made a valiant attempt to get there one-handed, landing just short
tossed up on off, prodded away
gone, skied to long-on! Ugly swipe from Maharaj, running down and trying to put the hurt on the spinner, instead he spoons a steepler to Pat Cummins, who steadies himself and takes a good catch
back of a length, nibbling back in past the bat as Big Vern throws a cut out in the channel
straighter line, worked to leg
good length, 134kph outside off, lets this one go
again Hazlewood gets the ball to tail in, Philander does nick this one, but it dies in front of the keeper
touch short, on the pads and jabbed to midwicket
that's what he wants, a bit of width and Philander rocks back to crunch the ball behind point - raise of the bat for his half-century, team-mates applauding on the balcony. But no signal yet from Faf
tossed up on off and tapped back to the bowler
there she blows, heaved over long-on! Using those long levers, right under the ball and powered beyond the ropes. Could have been an opener, you know
pushed through, goes back to blocking
flat on off, taps the ball square
tossed up and clipped into the leg side
Lyon darts the ball on middle and leg, nudged away... Morkel survives comfortably enough
dug in short and Philander pulls through midwicket, takes the single
no fifty for Morkel today, Hazlewood bounces him out! Head-hunting bumper, 141kph and Morkel can only punch it up into the air, looping gently to gully - meaning Australia have been set 430 to win
tight line from wide on the crease, and met with a vertical bat, pushing to mid-on
ooh, nip off the seam! Thuds into Bancroft's back pad, but sliding down the leg side. Brisk pace
awkwardly poked into the leg side, and Bancroft is up and running for this innings
lovely carry through to the keeper on a wide line
firmly behind the line, holding his bat as vertical as can be
angled defence down through third man. A solid first over for both teams
tight line to the left-hander, stabbed out to cover
dangling the bat outside off, a firm connection as the ball flies to point
good areas from Big Vern, on and around off stump with a hint of inswing to the left-hander
defended on the back foot
firmly pushed into the covers, and Markram stretches well to intercept
solidly behind the line once more
fired down the leg side, sounded like a flick of something as it went by, but no bat involved
back on the straight and narrow, Bancroft stands tall on the back foot to defend
shoulders arms outside off, well judged as the ball swings late
outside off, jagging off the seam as Bancroft leaves alone
defended back down the pitch once more, Rabada keeps knocking at the door
solid stride and pushed to mid-off
pops off the deck, sharp lift from a good length
very tight line on off stump, Warner gets right behind the ball to defend
a hint of seam movement as this jags off the deck and past the edge, Well bowled, always dragging the batsman onto the front foot
left alone more comfortably this time, on a tight line but back of a length this time
blocked firmly back down the pitch, half a thought of a single but then a loud 'no!'
more sharp lift from a good length! Warner climbs with the ball to block back down into the pitch. Awkward out there
more nip and bounce! Bancroft plays the line but the ball gets big on him and thumps the bottom elbow. Ouch
oh, that's a beauty! Pace, bounce, movement, tight line, Bancroft can't lay a bat on it as it fizzes through to the keeper
banged in short, Bancroft flinches in his stance as the ball zips by
well bowled again! Just too sharp from Rabada, zinging this one into the inner thigh as Bancroft can barely react to the heat on display. This is quality
and this is quality too! Rabada was looking for swing on a fuller length, but Bancroft shrugged off the blow to the groin, marched onto the front foot and laced his drive though the covers
pushed onto the back foot to defend
very full length, drilled in the air through the covers, but Warner picked his gap well
fully onto the front foot, and defended back down the pitch
tucked through square leg as Philander goes too straight
fully onto the front foot, pushed into the covers
curling past the edge, swing from the hand, as Bancroft is dragged outside off in the process
defended on the back foot, into the off side
back of a length, nudged to the leg side
back of a length, Warner hops into line to defend
full and fast, pushed back down the pitch
tucked to the leg side
ooh, the first sign of frustration from Warner, who spots a hint of length to play with and swings into a massive pull. But the ball is too quick and zips through the stroke
back on a fuller length, stout defence this time
edged, but doesn't carry! Tight line outside off, and through to the slips on the bounce
pushed cautiously into the covers
ooh, swing outside off, and this beats him all ends up
holds its line, defended on the back foot, to the leg side
clipped off the pads, down to deep square leg
anchored in the crease, pushing into the covers
flipped down to deep backward square. Solid contact and Bancroft is looking fluent
sliding down the leg side once more
riding the bounce and flinching the ball into the leg side again
dabbed down to third man
through to the keeper, outside off
well bowled again, cutting back into the batsman and zipping past the edge
a chance! A loose push into the covers as Morkel's steepling bounce surprises Warner on the drive, but the ball just eludes short cover!
much fuller, more languid in defence
clipped off the hip out to deep square leg
pops off the leading edge as Warner is squared up on the back foot. Morkel's bounce is knocking at the door
worked to leg once more. Sharp lift again
tight line on off stump, pushed back down the pitch
more lift off the deck, awkwardly squeezed off the hip by Bancroft, to square leg
where was the short leg! More pace and bounce, flicks the inside edge, and loops up invitingiy on the leg side
tucked to the leg side, more good bounce from a full length, but well enough negotiated
nothing wrong with that delivery! Searing heat outside off stump and climbing through to the keeper
flipped through the leg side, that's Warner's belligerence to the fore, not especially short but picked it early and found the gap at midwicket
pushed to the off side
through to the keeper and left alone
jags off the seam on a full length, and thuds into the inner thigh pad
defended back down the pitch
kicking bounce on a good length, Bancroft hoists his gloves high to avoid contact
left alone outside off stump
short and wide, no need to chase that
a hint of width this time, and Warner opens the face well, running the ball through third man and over the rope
tapped through third man, and that races away too. Useful flurry for Australia
solidly behind the line on off stump
cramped for room, squeezes to cover
tight line again, jabs down late to glide into the off side
well beaten outside off, late outswing, and through to the keeper
nipping through to the keeper, tight line, back of a length, threatening stuff but Bancroft hangs tight
onto the front foot, meeting the fuller length, and punching into the gap in the covers. That's good placement
firmly defended behind the line of the ball
fully onto the front foot, and punched through the covers. A good chase to haul it back, just inside the rope
a good-looking delivery, jagging off the seam and past the edge. But perhaps half a yard too short to snag the bat on its way through
down the leg side, and gathered by the keeper
full length, full face, defended back down the pitch
left alone outside off, through to the keeper
thumped through the covers off the back foot, Warner scampers back for the third as the fielder slides round to intercept
outside off, through to the keeper
dangled outside off, not this time
outside off, no stroke offered
defended on the back foot, into the off side
blocked once more
defended into the off side
full faced drive into the covers
no stroke offered outside off
zips past the outside edge, and Australia have made it to tea with all their wickets intact
over the wicket to Warner, tossed up with some overspin, tucked to the leg side coming forwards
pushed through on off and defended
flatter, goes back and taps the ball to the on side
drops short and Warner goes after him, hoicked over midwicket, there's a man out there but they get a couple as he runs around
looped full, aiming for the rough outside off stump, Warner stretches out and stabs the ball square
tries to come forward now, pushed a little uppishly back to the right of the bowler, falls short of being a chance
charges in and hits a length around middle and off, blocked from the crease
whistles through, that's a beauty, climbing and decking away past the bat as Bancroft dangles it outside off

oh wee, so close to playing on! Fuller, 140kph from Rabada and it nips in, Bancroft played expansively on the drive and a big inside edge cleared the stumps, flying away for four! That bit of luck means Australia pass 50 without loss
comes across and defends the ball square on the off side
sliding in on a length, 141kph and tapped away to the on side
rising sharply outside off, lets this one go
floated up outside off stump and pushed into the covers
gives it some air, played defensively on the back foot
half a shout for lbw, nice dip and spin as Warner comes down, turns inside the bat and into the front pad... would have been speculative to give, though, a long way down
'catch!' yells Maharaj as Warner pops a drive, lands well in front of extra cover
floated up and turned to the leg side coming down
Warner is quickly out of his crease again, this time Maharaj overpitches and is clipped firmly through point for four
another ripping riser from Rabada, past the bat as he prods tentatively
steered towards point from the crease
touch short, climbing through in the channel, lets this go
yippee ki yay, that's almost done for Bancroft! Short of a length, he was trying to come forwards but it got big and then swerved past the bat, so close to tickling it through to de Kock!
comes across and defended down to the leg side
shortish, Bancroft blocks from the crease

oh, this is going to be a run-out... Direct hit from Faf and Bancroft is miles short! Bancroft has been strung up again, this time by Warner calling for a suicidal single into the covers, he would have been struggling even without du Plessis' lightning response! Swooped and threw in one motion, de Kock was leaning forwards but just opened his arms and allowed the ball to hit the stumps
stays over the wicket, Khawaja squeezes out a single with the spin
pushed through on the stumps, blocked
tossed up around the line of off, defended coming forwads
pushed through, 87kph and tucked to the leg side
shouts of interest as Warner goes back to a slower delivery and nudges behind square
short of a length, 138kph from over the wicket, Khawaja lines it up
comes across his stumps to defend
yowch, that's bitten, short ball outside off and Uzzie gets into a tangle trying to leave, hit on the arm
tight lines, back of a length and this one he judges better, no shot
spandex-tight line from Rabada, zipping through outside off stump but Khawaja again leaves confidently
sprayed a little wider, 137kph and he lets another one through to the keeper

oh, gets it through him, but the stumping chance is missed! Drift and turn, inside the bat but de Kock was unsighted and it bobbled away from him, had to attempt to underarm it back on to the wicket as Warner scurried to regain his ground
flighted, beats the outside edge now! Went on with the arm, past the bat and into de Kock's gloves
tossed up and prodded away watchfully
angled in and blocked
Warner gets forward and works with the spin for a single
tossed up and spinning in from outside off, Khawaja stays back and defends

another one gone, Rabada rips out Warner again! Excellent low take by de Villiers, he points to Rabada, who opens his arms and looks to the sky... No need to say anything. He rather guided that to third slip, stood a little wide, but SA won't care how they come
back of a length outside off, Smith pogos across and defends calmly
shortish, 138kph and it kicks, hits the shoulder of the bat and flies low to point as Smith squares up
woof, banged in short, 143kph and that's left a comet trail into the gloves as Smith sways back
back of a length, Smith gets into line and defends
Smith shoulders arms, struck on the thigh... going over the top!

tossed up, draws him out... and a thick edge goes to slip! Three in a blink for SA! Maharaj gets the wicket he so nearly had in his previous over, a nicely flighted bit of cheese followed by the mousetrap snapping shut on Khawaja

gottim, brilliantly caught at forward short leg! Maharaj goes charging off, he's on a hat-trick, Australia are four down and Newlands is in foment! Spinning in and jabbed away off his glove, the ball looped to Markram's right and he stuck out a golden paw to take the catch as he crashed to earth!
round the wicket, straightening a touch, defended without drama
floated up full, Marsh lunges out to defend
flighted, punched firmly into the man at silly point on the bounce
gives it some air, Marsh blocks this one solidly to finish a double-wicket maiden for Keshav Maharaj
slung down in the channel, lets it go
back of a length, thundering through outside off and Smith leaves again
rapid from Rabada, 143kph and rising sharply as Smith thrusts his hands up
shortish, again Smith gets into line
back of a length, wide of off stump and again he leaves it well alone
angled in a touch more, 138kph and Smith blocks
tossed up from round the wicket, stroked through mid-off
full and flighted, Smith gets off the mark with a drilled single to long-off
yelps of excitement around the bat as Marsh leaves, the ball smuggling its way past off stump... just a inch or two away!
tossed up and tapped away
lovely shot from Marsh, overpitched on middle and off, makes room and crumps it through the covers
nicely bowled, dipping and getting Marsh reaching out for it, stabbed away
Smith shuffles across and lets a shortish ball go
Rabada has found a mesmeric groove here, but it's a touch short and wide again, Smith can leave without fear
fuller, still wide in the channel, 135kph, no stroke offered
slightly back of a length, again Smith doesn't need to play
takes on the hook, and the top edge sails all the way! Pace and bounce from Rabada, 143kph and targeting the batsman, Smith will take the dividend, though
back worrying away in the corridor, Smith happy to leave
wheeling away round the wicket, tapped to cover
flighted, entices him to go harder at a drive, manages to keep it down as the close fielders groan in expectation
floated up and blocked on the front foot
drops short, Marsh sees it early and is in position to throw those Popeye forearms through a powerful cut for four
lobbed up closer to the stumps, Marsh defends
comes forward and punches to cover
over the wicket, short of a length outside off, 135kph and left alone by Smith
fuller, gets him driving, Smith lances it to cover coming forwards

now Smith's out, a carbon copy dismissal - steered to gully again! Back of a length and climbing as Smith threw the hands, a thick outside edge flew with laser-guided precision into Elgar's midriff! The deposed captain is dismissed, Australia are five down and Newlands is drinking it all in!
dug in short and Paine slams a pull away to the square-leg boundary, off the mark with a counterpunch
pitched up a bit more, shaping away as Paine sticks his head out and leaves
short of a length, this comes back in but it was wide to start with, no stroke required
dragged forward, pushed to cover
an emphatic wallop clean through point! Well, why not. Maharaj tossed it out a touch wide, and here's a chance to send some close fielders scattering like pigeons
fully forward, head over the ball
flogged on the up, out to deep cover
looped up, and pushed to the off side
cracked fiercely off the back foot, a tumbling stop from Philander at backward point
squared up on the back foot, and pushed back down the pitch
caught on the crease a touch, tentatively poked into the off side
wow, that is a perfect off-stump lifter, full length, exploding off the seam, and past a startled splice!
wider line, no stroke this time
drilled into the covers
left alone outside off stump
flogged into the covers, where Maharaj intercepts with ninja reactions.That was travelling
pushed out to cover with a full face of the bat
deflected down into the off side, just wide of slip
left alone outside off
nothing doing here
low full toss on the pads, gratefully clipped away

another one bites the dust! A massive energetic hook, a total miscue, and de Villiers at third slip is sufficiently alert to dive forward and scoop a low chance, while the rest of the fielders would probably have been looking to midwicket! This is a complete meltdown of Australian resolve now. Their chances of on-field redemption were slim anyway, but this is grim for them now

fierce and fast, and Morkel is on a hat-trick! Or is it? Cummins has reviewed, he thinks that has come off his wrist, not his glove, but it was savagely short and leapt like a cobra into his flinching defensive hop. Now then, that looks to have hit his wristband, which might technically make it glove... which might definitely confirm it is out! Yep, off he goes!
driven with hard hands, but good contact, over mid-off, through the vacancies created by the attacking field. and all the way to the rope
speared outside off stump, no contact this time
banged in short, and flinched down into the leg-side, just wide of short leg!
banged in short again, Starc rides the bounce
round the wicket, clipped up to mid-on and they need a bit of scamper to make it for the single, but Rabada's shy is well wide
turn from outside off, and blocked
thumped down the ground to mid-off
stands tall on the back foot, blocked into the covers
squeezed in the air, past the flailing short leg. Tricksy turn and bounce to the left-hander
punched with intent to short cover
dumped with intent, back over the bowler's head. Starc wants to go down swinging
through to the keeper this time, more threatening bounce
pop from a good length, and so close to short leg! Right off the face of the bat, but luckily for Starc it went straight down the pitch and out of the fielder's grasp
short, pulled, thwacked! Ouch, that utterly clanged the helmet, Starc was through the shot before he knew it, and that's a nasty blow to the temple. He seems fine, but understandable concern
pushed onto the back foot from round the wicket. Blocked
pop-a-doodle-do... easy pickings for short leg! Trademark Morkel length, angling in, exploding off the deck, pounding the bat, and looping into Markram's hands under the lid!
tossed up on the toes, flicked to the leg side
flicked into the leg side, bottom hand coming through as the ball is gathered at mid-on
full face of the bat, punched back to the bowler
poked into the covers

forward, and tapped into the covers, a crazy sharp single, to Bavuma of all people, and blow me down, that's out! A fast flat shy, a fine gather from de Kock, and Lyon is run out without facing a ball!
angled bat, defensive prod
